data.title: Hot Exit: Restore files after an editor crashes
data.body: Vscode is so excellent , we love it very much!  But this days vscode still has some bugs making it crash, especially when I work with big project that open so many files at the same time. And when vscode reopenes after crashed, the file openning status rolls back to that when I openned it last time, not the status when it alert  "no responding". This make some inconvenience for us to contunue our work. So I hope vscode can save the file openning status when it crash.

data.title: Home - Go to Beginning of Line (real)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. put cursor in line, which starting with tabs or spaces
2. press "Home"-key

Exp.: cursor in start of the line, as wrote in help ( https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/keybindings ) - "Go to Beginning of Line"

Act.: cursor before first non space character.

Can you add setting for "Home" key to really "Go to Beginning of Line"?

thank you.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the Search tab.
2. click the "sensitive"
3. To enter a word for search and replace
4. click the "Replace"
5. turn off the "sensitive"
6. No results found (but they exist). If you enter the word again, the search results there.

data.title: jsonFormatter:applyEdit() could format values nicely
data.body:
See comment from @isidorn in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1396#issuecomment-248294777 where we see that filling in a complex object to a settings file does not format it but puts it on a single line.

I have seen this before already when storing a more complex object to settings (e.g. file associations).

data.title: Request: Project Templates

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be a huge improvement if vscode had the ability of templating projects.

As there are already a lot of Variables available, it should not be that hard to create projects out of templates.

---

example structure of a template: 

/
- project.json
- readme.md
- content
  |- files of project to be populated

---

project templates could then be packed as zip or tar packages and also get cloned from repositories or something like that.

data.title: Git: Open File doesn't work when the diff editor is opened for a staged file (because readonly?)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Make a change in a file. Go to the Git pane, click the file to open the diff editor. Open the command palette and run "Git: Open File". This works.

Stage the file and open the diff editor. Try to run "Git: Open File" again. Nothing happens.

Maybe the difference is that in the second case, the file is readonly?

data.title: Feature request ? Focus follows mouse.
data.body:
I have this set on my OS and I can save files when I mouse off the vscode window.

But I wonder why inside vscode the focus does not follow the mouse ie if I have the integrated terminal open I have to click inside that pane before typing, then click back on the editor window etc.

Not such a big deal but I guess I am so used to working this way and it seems like it could be a easy fix to add a setting, I did search for one but found nothing obvious.

data.title: Feature Request: Zoom control UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: 10.0.14393

Would be great to have a zoom control UI as for Visual Studio:
- On status bar with editable ComboBox of zoom percentages (note bottom-left (on LTR) corner of VS2015 as an example).
- ~~Ctrl + Mouse-wheel providing smooth zoom in/out control (btw this is supported by many apps at OS level).~~ [ **this feature exists already** - thanks @chrmarti ]

Hope this is not a dupe request.

data.title: i18n: incorrect strings at feedback panel
data.body: Russian translations of strings _"character left"_/_"characters left"_ use _'left'_ as direction (e.g. turn left). It would be great to fix it using _"символ остался"_/_"символов осталось"_ respectively.

data.title: sorry. wrong place, please delete
data.body: wrong place

data.title: Debug: is there a way to terminate preLaunchTask process (when debug stops)?
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

I am debugging my server (node) code and I added a "start cdn server" preLaunchTask. This task is starting an express server which serves my static files (I want to be able to open my browser and enter server code in debug mode).

While it works fine, I want to be able to kill this cdn server process when debug stops. I was expecting the prelaunch task to be a child process of the debug process, which would solve my problem, but it isn't (it is a child process of VS Code).

Is there a reasonable solution to my problem?

data.title: String inspector incorrectly escapes \ escape codes (both \r and \\r becomes \r)
data.body:
The string inspector in the debugger incorrectly displays \ escape codes - both \r and \\r becomes \r

This happens both in hovering variables, copying values from the variables view, and in the debug console.
- VSCode Version: 1.5
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start a node project, set a breakpoint anywhere
2. Once it hits, in the "debug console" type: "foo\r\nbar\\r\\nzar\\" - incorrectly displays "foo\r\nbar\r\nzar\", should display "foo\r\nbar\\r\\nzar\\"

Edit: had to escape the \ codes in the GitHub comment as well! :Ø

data.title: Should we drop the minimal icon theme?
data.body:
I think the minimal icon theme does not look very good compared to our seti theme. I think our original motivation to have it was because we wanted to ship with a least one icon theme. But now that we ship with seti out of the box, imho we should drop the minimal icon theme.

Thoughts?

One reasoning is that we now start to introduce icons everywhere and imho the minimal theme does not add much value in that case:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/18667213/e7ea8d90-7f2f-11e6-8e95-019fa62f8c54.png)

//cc @chrisdias @seanmcbreen @egamma

data.title: Menu actions affect wrong window/project if menu in second window is clicked while menu active in first window.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Insider Preview (Fast Ring) Build 14926

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode (let's call this Window 1)
2. Open an additional window (Window 2) via File > New Window such that the menu bars of both windows are visible.
3. Click "File" in Window 1.
4. While that menu is open, click "File" in Window 2 and select "Open." Open anything.

Expected behaviour: File opens in Window 2.

Actual behaviour: File opens in Window 1.

It doesn't appear to matter what menu item or action you select in steps 3 or 4. Whichever action it is is applied to Window 1's editor/project.

data.title: Remote drive: Execute permission removed from file on save when saving

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. have a file on a remote drive that has execute permission on underlying linux system

```
-rwxr-xr-x  1 frantisek frantisek  2131 Sep 20 09:26 wo
```
1. edit the file in vs code, save
2. file now lacks execute permission for user:

```
-rw-r-xr-x  1 frantisek frantisek  2131 Sep 20 09:26 wo
```

data.title: find symbol is slower than sublime text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  install python extension 
2.  open the same file in the same project in vscode and sublime text,
3.  ctl+shift+o in vscode, and  ctl+r in sublime text,  vscode list all the symbol is slower than sublime text almost in 10 times.  and vscode can not list symbol in tree structure like sublime text doing.

vscode has debug tools is better than sublime text, sublime text is faster than vscode.
any improvement ?
